competitive_intel:
## Available Competitive Intelligence

- Competition description: `../research/description.md`
- 5 top kernel notebooks in `../research/kernels/`

data_findings.finding: Best achieved score: 70.625-70.676. Target: 68.894234. Gap: ~1.73-1.78 points (2.5%). All standard SA/bbox3 optimizers converge to same local optimum. Small N (1-10) have worst efficiency (37-65%) - most room for improvement. CV = LB exactly.

Key techniques from kernels: 1) bbox3 C++ optimizer with SA, 2) fix_direction rotation optimization, 3) shake_public for perturbation, 4) Pre-optimized santa-2025.csv as baseline. The saspav kernel combines these with 11.6 hours runtime.

tree_packer_v21.cpp uses: 1) Multi-start SA with different angle restarts, 2) Swap move operator, 3) Higher temperature SA, 4) Boundary tree identification for targeted moves, 5) Tree removal cascade (N→N-1). All N values processed in parallel with OpenMP.

Ensemble approach: Collect best solutions from 19+ sources (datasets, notebooks, GitHub), take best score for each N value independently. N=1 optimal is 45 degrees rotation. Sources include bucket-of-chump, SmartManoj GitHub, telegram shared solutions, various optimization notebooks.

Best snapshot score: 70.625918. N=1 has worst score (0.661250). Small N values (1-10) have highest per-N scores, confirming they have most room for improvement. Score ranges: N=1-50: 19.03, N=51-100: 17.61, N=101-150: 17.14, N=151-200: 16.84
